name: DataDogLoggingResponse
policy_content:
<ServiceCallout async="true" continueOnError="true" enabled="true" xmlns="http://www.sap.com/apimgmt">
	<Request>
		<Set>
			<Headers>
				<Header name="Content-Type">application/json</Header>
				<Header name="DD-API-KEY">{dataDog.APIKey}</Header>
			</Headers>
			<Payload contentType="application/json" variablePrefix="#"
        variableSuffix="@">{
              "ddsource": "SAPIM",
              "message": "/#request.verb@ #proxy.pathsuffix@",
              "ddtags": "env:#dataDog.Env@,type:request_response",
              "hostname": "#dataDog.Hostname@",
              "service": "#preflow.name@",
              "client" : "#client.host@",
              "product":"#product.name@",
              "status":"#postflow.ddstatus@",
              "description": "#postflow.dddescription@",
              "request": {
                "method":"#request.verb@",
                "payload":"#preflow.content@",
                "apikey":"#preflow.apikey@",
                "AppName":"#dataDog.application@"
              },
                "response": {
                  "payload":"#postflow.payload@"
              }
            }</Payload> 
			<Verb>POST</Verb>
		</Set>
	</Request>
	<!--Remove Response Element if you want Service Callout work Asynchronous--> 
	<Response>splunk.response</Response>
	<Timeout>30000</Timeout>
	<HTTPTargetConnection>
		<URL>https://http-intake.logs.datadoghq.com/api/v2/logs</URL>
	</HTTPTargetConnection>
</ServiceCallout>
